Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

## Files to Create

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

- Navigate to /swagger and test each endpoint
- Confirm Blazor components still work with @inject

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

## Files to Modify
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Homespun.Tests.csproj - Add bUnit package

## Files to Create
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/ProjectDetailTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/PullRequestTreeTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/SessionChatTests.cs
- (additional component tests as needed)

## Verification
- Run: dotnet test tests/Homespun.Tests
- All bUnit tests should pass

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI

- IssueList - Fleece issue display

- All bUnit tests should pass

I would like to add a branch/worktree page for each project at the route /projects/id/branches. This should list all of the currently started worktrees in the project, allowing me to start and stop agents in the worktree, pull recent changes and delete worktrees and branches (both local and remote). It should also show which worktrees have PRs associated with them, and the status of the worktrees. Only branches and worktrees that have been merged should be allowed to be deleted without warning. Otherwise, a warning modal should be shown.

It should also show all remote branches that have not been pulled. I should be able to create new local worktrees from these branches.

These custom agents prompts for now should just be the build and plan prompts that are currently available. The prompts themselves can be saved in the homespun-data.json file. These are global settings that affects all projects.

It should be possible to start agents on PRs as well as on issues. This should check whether the PR branch already has a worktree. If not, it should create a new worktree and start the agent. If it does have a worktree, ensure there are no current agents sessions running in that worktree, then pull recent changes to that worktree and start the agent.

Use a TDD approach in development.

propertyChanges.newValue:
Add a button to rebase any open worktrees onto main to the worktrees page. This button should start a new agent that pulls the most recent main branch and rebases onto that. The agents should fix any merge conflicts, review recently merged PRs descriptions and run all tests to ensure no regressions after rebasing.

Add a special rebase agent prompts to the agent management page that can be started on a worktree.
PR and issue linking doesn't work

The UI is currently scattered within various individual pages, and some components exist as separate files while others are embedded in pages. This is making it difficult to manage UI quality and consistency.

Please review the current pages and styling and put together a plan for consolidating this as much as possible by extracting reusable components.

Add tailwind to the project and use this as a centralised styling system. A guide to using tailwind with Blazor may be found here: https://github.com/tesar-tech/BlazorAndTailwind?tab=readme-ov-file. Keep the existing styles (colours, fonts, etc.) as much as possible.

There should be a button on the project page to synchronise the fleece issues in the default branch. When clicked, this should commit all files in the project's `.fleece/` folder and push them. It should then pull all changes back from main and refresh the graph. Notify the user if there are issues with pulling the changes back from main - if there are, provide an option to the user to stash or discard all changes in the main branch and try pulling again.

Currently PRs and issues are not being linked together. When a PR is created with a branch matching that of an issue. The issue should have the PR added to it's "linked PRs" property. Issues with linked PRs should not be shown in the UI but the information should instead be shown alongside the PR summary when the PR is clicked. This linking should occur on project refresh when new PRs are synced and downloaded.

Show PR status in details and timeline

A PR should show whether it is ready to merge and if all checks pass, fail or are running in the issue detail. This should be used to drive agent options such as auto rebasing or asking an agent to fix all checks.

Create mocks for all services with fake data sets. The aim is to provide an environment switch for the application that, when enabled, swaps out the live services for the mocks. This will allow a test application to be run that does not persist and affect any production data.

Create a test data store that has in memory persistence to allow adding and deleting data.

Much of this probably already exists in the test libraries. Do not recreate it - migrate it to the main project into a test folder and refactor the tests to use this data.

Create a custom timeline renderer to replace the git-grapj.js renderer. It should be functionally similar, a simple two column grid drawn. Each row should be one Blazor component.

The left column should be the graph itself, drawn as individual SVG. The right column will include the text and any annotations to denote issue, agent and PR status.

Implement a graph layout algorithm that performs a similar function. Keep track of "lanes" that run vertically and perform a DFS of the graph to determine the lane structure. This can be done in two passes, first to calculate the maximum number of lanes (to determine the SVG width) and then to lay out the lanes.

Use simple straight lines with bends to show lane switching.

The 'Start Test Agent' button in the project information panel should be hidden using preprocessor directives to only show in Debug builds
Allow dev and release containers on the same machine

It should be possible to run a dev and a release container on the same machine. Dev containers should have the hostname `homespun-dev` and be run using the latest local build. Production containers should use watchtower to pull from the GitHub container registry and have `homespun` as the hostname. They should both be run from the run.sh and run.ps1 scripts. I believe that this is already possible, it just needs to be able to inject the hostname into the Docker configuration.
Allow for arbitrary agents to be run on a worktree
Currently only 'build' and 'plan' agents can be run with prompts injected in. A general purpose agent should be able to be started on any worktree.
The  leece search tool no longer works, stating Error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'source').

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

## Files to Create

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

## Verification
- Navigate to /swagger and test each endpoint
- Confirm Blazor components still work with @inject

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

## Files to Modify
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Homespun.Tests.csproj - Add bUnit package

## Files to Create
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/ProjectDetailTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/PullRequestTreeTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/SessionChatTests.cs
- (additional component tests as needed)

## Verification
- Run: dotnet test tests/Homespun.Tests
- All bUnit tests should pass

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

## Files to Create

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

## Verification
- Navigate to /swagger and test each endpoint
- Confirm Blazor components still work with @inject

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

## Files to Modify
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Homespun.Tests.csproj - Add bUnit package

## Files to Create
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/ProjectDetailTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/PullRequestTreeTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/SessionChatTests.cs
- (additional component tests as needed)

## Verification
- Run: dotnet test tests/Homespun.Tests
- All bUnit tests should pass

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

Allow dev and release containers on the same machine

It should be possible to run a dev and a release container on the same machine. Dev containers should have the hostname `homespun-dev` and be run using the latest local build. Production containers should use watchtower to pull from the GitHub container registry and have `homespun` as the hostname. They should both be run from the run.sh and run.ps1 scripts. I believe that this is already possible, it just needs to be able to inject the hostname into the Docker configuration.
Allow for arbitrary agents to be run on a worktree
Currently only 'build' and 'plan' agents can be run with prompts injected in. A general purpose agent should be able to be started on any worktree.

A REST API should be designed and implemented to allow programmatic access to the underlying functionality of Homespun. This will allow a client server architecture to be implemented, as well as allow API access. It should be documented as a Swagger API.

propertyChanges.oldValue: A REST API should be designed and implemented to allow programmatic access to the underlying functionality of Homespun. This will allow a client server architecture to be implemented, as well as allow API access. It should be documented as a Swagger API.
propertyChanges.newValue: A REST API should be designed and implemented to allow programmatic access to the underlying functionality of Homespun. This will should simplify agentic access for testing backend functionality on live applications. The methods that are called by the API should be the same methods that are called by the application front end. It should be documented as a Swagger API.
Add REST API with Swagger for backend testing

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

## Files to Create

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

## Verification
- Navigate to /swagger and test each endpoint
- Confirm Blazor components still work with @inject

Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

## Files to Modify
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Homespun.Tests.csproj - Add bUnit package

## Files to Create
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/ProjectDetailTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/PullRequestTreeTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/SessionChatTests.cs
- (additional component tests as needed)

## Verification
- Run: dotnet test tests/Homespun.Tests
- All bUnit tests should pass

The branch and worktree management system needs some improvement as it blocks agents from starting and has become difficult to manage.

## Branches page

### Active worktrees panel

- This shows "Plan" and "Build" buttons for each of the worktrees. Replace these with the normal agent management control that is used in the issues details. If this is not already a separate Blazor component, extract it to one now.
- Show "lost worktrees", these being the folders that reside beside the main folder but are not associated with the branch. Tag these as being "Lost".
- Add a button to delete the lost worktrees (deleting the worktree folder completely) and to "repair" the worktree by attaching it back to a branch (if a matching branch can be found).
- Add a tag to show any worktrees (including main) that are not checked out against the branch that matches the name of the worktree. Add a button to checkout the correct target branch and to get it back on task.
- Show the current git status (number of files modified) for all worktrees.
- Add a global button to prune all worktrees.
- Show the agent session status against worktrees that have an agent running in them.

### Local branches

- Move the local branches with PRs into a new panel "Open PRs". Only include local branches without PRs in this list.
- It appears that the branches with PRs that were squash merged don't show up as being related to PRs and don't show up as "merged". Update this so that local branches are tracked against PRs that have been merged. 
- Show if branches are local only **and** remote or just local only with a tag showing that it is local only.

### Remote branches

- Show which of these branches have been merged (or squash merged) to main.
- Add a button to delete the remote branch.
- Ensure that when "checkout" is clicked that this also creates a new worktree. Currently when this is clicked it checks out the branch to the root worktree, and then tries to create the worktree. It fails to do this as two worktrees cannot be checked out with the same branch. Instead, it should create the worktree first and leave the default branch alone.

Implement this using a TDD approach.
